question.body: Which part of the brain has noticeable superior and lateral gyri (folds) that increase surface area for cortical gray matter?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is an internal part of the brain seen mainly when sectioned.
Incorrect. This has distinctive small folded ridges, but they are called folia, and it is located posteriorly and inferior to the main part of the brain that does have gyri.
Correct. These parts of the cerebrum have the gyri and sulci on the surface and even extending down either side of the medial deep longitudinal fissure between hemispheres.
Incorrect. This inferior section connecting to the spinal cord does not have gyri and sulci.
Incorrect. This is a bulging part of the brainstem and does not have gyri and sulci.
